section_purpose: To introduce the empirical evaluation framework for STRCMP, including the problem classes, datasets, baselines, and overarching research questions.
key_points: Evaluates STRCMP on two combinatorial optimization problem classes: mixed-integer linear programming (MILP) and Boolean satisfiability (SAT).
Uses over nine benchmark datasets for comprehensive testing.
Benchmarks against five established baselines, covering neural optimization methods and contemporary LLM-based approaches.
Aims to address specific research questions to assess efficacy and efficiency.

datasets: Mixed-integer linear programming (MILP) and Boolean satisfiability (SAT) datasets, totaling over nine benchmark datasets (specific names not provided).

dependencies: Section 3 (Problem Statement) for understanding the combinatorial optimization problems
Section 4 (Proposed Solution) for details on STRCMP methodology
reproducibility_notes: Need specific benchmark dataset names and sources for MILP and SAT problems.
Require exact details on the five baselines used for comparison.
Research questions must be defined to guide the experimental setup and evaluation metrics.
